AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.cocaine: evidence discovered during an immigration stop on Interstate 35, subject of appeal regarding suppression order, crucial for the case against Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: party in the appeal, appellant regarding post-verdict suppression order, responsible for filing notice of appeal within 30 days after suppression decision is final, restricted by the law of the case doctrine, lacks legally cognizable interest in the outcome due to mootness
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals: court hearing the appeal, bound by the law of the case doctrine, dismisses the United States of America's appeal due to lack of an adequate case or controversy
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.defendant Smith: indicted suspect in an arson case, joined United States of America on the motion to subpoena footage
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso: defendant in a criminal case involving cocaine discovered during an immigration stop, argued against the United States of America's right to appeal the judgment for acquittal, subject of a now moot appeal
